# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
end
```
This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym`. The values in this new column are obtained by mapping the `year` and `month` functions onto each element of the `dt` column, then concatenating these into an integer. 

You can use this function like so:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with values "202101" and "202202", respectively.
